intro: Dianthus plumarius subsp. regis-stephani, commonly known as the Regal Steppe Pink, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
